questions.question: Quick pitch - About yourself
questions.answer:
I am Adefemi Kolawole, I'm a Power BI developer with extensive experience in Business Intelligence across various industries, including healthcare, insurance, retail, and logistics, helping them tackle their challenges in transforming complex data into actionable insights and unifying diverse reporting needs.

I currently work for Manhattan Associates and before them, I worked for Northside Hospital.

My core responsibilities consistently involved delivering automated, interactive dashboards and robust reporting solutions, specifically unifying KPI dashboards, addressing data quality, and enhancing data accessibility.

I achieved this by integrating diverse data sources, leveraging tools like Power BI, Power Query, Databricks, and SSIS, and implementing features such as row-level security (RLS) and data validation. I also engaged stakeholders to refine KPIs and applied front-end design principles for intuitive user interfaces.

This consistently led to significant improvements, including reduced reporting turnaround times, improved data trust with fewer errors, and elimination of manual tracking, ultimately empowering leadership with real-time visibility and supporting critical business decisions.

questions.question: Tell me about yourself - 1 Minute Pitch (STAR Method)
questions.answer: S: Hi, I'm a Business Intelligence professional with broad experience spanning retail, healthcare, insurance, and logistics. In every role, my mission has been to transform intricate business data into clear, actionable insights through automated and interactive dashboards. T: I've consistently delivered robust reporting solutions, specializing in unifying key performance indicators, enhancing data quality, and significantly improving data accessibility for stakeholders. A: My approach involves seamlessly integrating diverse data sources and leveraging powerful tools like Power BI, Power Query, Databricks, SQL, DAX, Python, and SSIS to build efficient ETL pipelines and insightful reports. R: The results speak for themselves: I've successfully reduced reporting turnaround times, boosted data trust by minimizing errors, and eliminated manual tracking, ultimately providing leadership with real-time visibility to support critical business decisions. I'm passionate about driving data-driven improvements and am eager to bring this proven ability to your team.

questions.question: Why do you want to leave your current job?
questions.answer: S: In my current role, I have gained valuable experience managing projects and delivering results, but I have reached a point where growth opportunities are limited. T: My goal is to continue developing professionally by taking on more responsibility and working on challenging projects that align with my long-term career objectives. A: To achieve this, I am actively seeking a role where I can apply my skills in new ways, collaborate with diverse teams, and contribute to meaningful initiatives that match my values. R: I believe this change will allow me to have a greater impact, enhance my skills, and maintain a better work-life balance, ultimately benefiting both my career and the organization I join.
other_reasons:

questions.question: What's your salary expectation?
questions.answer: S: I understand that compensation is an important part of any job offer. T: My goal is to find a role that aligns with my skills and experience while also offering fair market compensation. A: I have researched industry standards for this position and considered my background and the value I bring. I'm open to discussing a competitive salary that reflects the responsibilities and opportunities of the role. R: Ultimately, I want to ensure a mutually beneficial agreement that supports my motivation and allows me to contribute effectively to the team.

additional_notes.description: Demonstrates you've done your homework and are reasonable. Provide a range that's competitive for the role, your experience, and the industry.
additional_notes.answer_example: Based on my research for similar roles in this industry and geographic area, considering my experience and skills, I'm looking for a salary in the range of [Lower Figure] to [Higher Figure]. I'm also open to discussing the entire compensation package, including benefits and bonuses.

additional_notes.description: If you're early in the process or don't have enough information, this shifts the focus back to the employer's budget, allowing you to learn more before committing.
additional_notes.answer_example: That's a great question, and I'd be happy to discuss salary. Before I provide a specific figure, I'd like to learn more about the full scope of responsibilities for this position and what the comprehensive compensation package looks like, including benefits, bonuses, and growth opportunities. What is the typical salary range for this role within your organization?

additional_notes.description: Emphasizes the value you bring rather than just a number, especially effective if you have unique skills or a strong track record.
additional_notes.answer_example: My primary focus is on finding a role where I can make a significant impact and contribute to the team's success, and I'm confident my skills in [mention key skills or achievements] align well with the requirements here. I'm looking for a compensation package that reflects the value I can bring to this role and the company. Could you share what the budgeted range is for this position?

additional_notes.description: Similar to the research-based range, but with an explicit acknowledgment of flexibility, which can be good if you're very interested in the role and want to keep doors open.
additional_notes.answer_example: Given my qualifications and what I understand of the responsibilities involved, I am expecting a salary in the [Lower Figure] to [Higher Figure] range. However, I'm flexible for the right opportunity and am more interested in the overall fit and the potential for growth within the company.

questions.question: Tell me about yourself - Healthcare
questions.answer: S: At Northside Hospital, I was part of the BI team supporting Community Health Needs Assessment (CHNA) and operations reporting. T: I was responsible for transforming static Excel-based reports into automated, interactive dashboards. A: I used Power BI, integrated public health data sources, and applied Power Query to automate refresh schedules and filters. R: This reduced CHNA turnaround time by 50%, enabled real-time tracking of community health indicators, and improved visibility for leadership.

questions.question: Tell me about yourself - Insurance
questions.answer: S: At Hiscox Insurance, I worked on underwriting and claims reporting projects with cross-functional teams. T: I was tasked with unifying KPI dashboards while addressing role-based access and recurring data quality issues. A: I built Power BI reports with row-level security (RLS), added a data validation dashboard, and engaged stakeholders to refine KPIs. R: This improved data trust, reduced errors by 40%, and helped standardize reporting across regions.

questions.question: Tell me about yourself - Retail
questions.answer: S: At Costco, we had less than a week to deliver a merchandising dashboard for an executive board review. T: I was responsible for integrating data from various retail sources and producing a user-ready dashboard. A: I used Databricks, SSIS, and Power BI to build the solution quickly, and drew on my web development background to make the interface intuitive and visually appealing. R: The dashboard was delivered early, reduced manual reporting by 40%, and was repurposed across three departments.

questions.question: Tell me about yourself - Logistics
questions.answer: S: At Manhattan Associates, I led BI initiatives for IT and operations teams, focusing on service level reporting and process optimization. T: I needed to unify data from Jira, Oracle, and ServiceNow, and build reliable SLA dashboards. A: I developed Power Query pipelines, used Dataflows for ETL, and applied validation and alerting logic to ensure accuracy. R: This reduced SLA violations by 18% and eliminated 40% of manual tracking work across support teams.

questions.question: Why should we hire you?
questions.answer: S: Companies need BI professionals who can translate complex data into actionable business intelligence.(Strategic Insight & Execution, End-to-End Solution Ownership, Collaborative Leadership ) T: You need someone who can deliver end-to-end Power BI solutions while understanding the bigger business context. A: I bring strategic insight to transform business challenges into robust Power BI solutions with scalable data models and advanced DAX. I own the entire development lifecycle - from data integration and transformation to visualization and security implementation. Additionally, I collaborate closely with stakeholders to understand core needs and foster data literacy. R: This comprehensive approach ensures you'll get more than just reports - you'll get actionable intelligence that drives better decision-making, maintains data integrity, increases user adoption, and delivers consistent, high-quality BI solutions with tangible business impact.

questions.question: Tell me about a time you had to work with a difficult team member.
questions.answer: At Northside Hospital, I worked with a developer who often missed deadlines. I scheduled a 1:1 to understand his challenges, discovered he was overloaded, and helped redistribute tasks. This improved our delivery and team morale.

questions.question: Describe a situation where you had to quickly learn a new tool or technology.
questions.answer: When I joined Hiscox, I had to learn Power BI Dataflows in under a week to meet a reporting deadline. I used Microsoft Learn, built a POC, and delivered the solution on time.

questions.question: How do you handle tight deadlines?
questions.answer: I break down the project into smaller tasks, prioritize based on impact, and communicate progress daily. At Manhattan Associates, this approach helped us deliver a critical dashboard 2 days early.

questions.question: Give an example of a time you failed and how you handled it.
questions.answer: I once underestimated the complexity of a data migration, causing a 2-day delay. I owned the mistake, communicated transparently, and worked overtime to resolve it, ensuring no data loss.

questions.question: Describe a time you had to persuade others to adopt your idea.
questions.answer: At a retail client, I proposed using Power BI Dataflows for reusable ETL. I presented a demo, highlighted time savings, and addressed concerns. The team adopted my approach, reducing future dev time by 30%.

questions.question: How do you prioritize multiple projects?
questions.answer: I use a matrix to assess urgency and impact, then communicate priorities with stakeholders. At Northside, this helped balance daily reporting with a major dashboard rollout.

questions.question: Tell me about a time you improved a process.
questions.answer: At Manhattan Associates, I automated data refreshes using Power BI Gateway and PowerShell scripts, reducing manual effort by 80% and eliminating refresh failures.

questions.question: Describe a time you had to deliver bad news to a client or stakeholder.
questions.answer: I had to inform a client about a delay due to a vendor API outage. I provided a revised timeline, regular updates, and a mitigation plan, which maintained trust and satisfaction.

questions.question: How do you handle feedback or criticism?
questions.answer: I view feedback as an opportunity to grow. After a dashboard review, I received feedback on visual clutter. I simplified the design, which improved user adoption and satisfaction.

questions.question: Give an example of a time you took initiative.
questions.answer: At Hiscox, I noticed recurring data quality issues. I created a data validation dashboard, which reduced errors by 40% and was later adopted by other teams.

questions.question: Tell me about a time you solved a complex problem
questions.answer: S: At Manhattan Associates, we were facing inconsistencies in SLA reporting due to disparate data sources from Jira, ServiceNow, and Oracle. T: I was tasked with standardizing the ingestion process and ensuring accurate, automated reporting for operations leadership. A: I engineered ingestion pipelines using Power Query and Dataflows, applied robust data validation logic, and built parameterized refresh schedules. I also added visual alerts for SLA breaches. R: This reduced SLA violations by 18%, improved stakeholder trust, and eliminated 40% of manual tracking tasks.

questions.question: Describe a time you improved a process
questions.answer: S: At Northside Hospital, the Community Health Needs Assessment (CHNA) reports were built manually using Excel and static charts. T: I needed to modernize this process to make the reporting faster and more insightful. A: I used Power BI and public health datasets to build interactive dashboards, added drill-through filters, and automated the data pipeline using Power Query. R: Turnaround time for CHNA reporting was reduced by 50%, and the team could easily track real-time community health indicators.

questions.question: Tell me about a time you had to work with a difficult stakeholder
questions.answer: S: At Hiscox Insurance, I was working with regional underwriting leads who had conflicting priorities regarding dashboard KPIs. T: I had to unify these views while respecting role-based access and differing reporting needs. A: I conducted stakeholder interviews, developed separate RLS-filtered views in Power BI, and built a dynamic reporting layer using semantic models. R: This improved satisfaction across teams, reduced access issues, and created a unified dashboard experience across four business units.

questions.question: Give an example of how you handled a tight deadline
questions.answer: S: At Costco, we had to deploy a merchandising dashboard for an upcoming board review with less than a week's notice. T: I was responsible for integrating multi-source retail data and building an executive-ready dashboard. A: I used Databricks with SSIS and Power Query to ingest and transform data quickly, while using templates and existing components to accelerate dashboard creation. R: The dashboard was delivered ahead of schedule, reducing manual reporting by 40% and was reused in three other departments.
